title: Fortnite is streaming 'Black hole' for its 'The End' event and it's driving people nuts — RT World News
text:
A black screen with a black dot is what Fortnite has been streaming on its social media channels as its long-anticipated 'The End' event. Millions have been staring at the black screen mesmerized for hours.

First there was a map, then a meteor and a bunch of rockets nuked it and all that was left was a 'black hole.' Shockwaves went through the fortnight community.

RIP Fortnite: Battle Royale



FULL LIVE REACTION TO THE END! pic.twitter.com/ifX4CJcnEK — Jack “CouRage” Dunlop (@CouRageJD) October 13, 2019

The End?

Well, millions willing to watch the new season of Fortnite Epic Games program don't think it's the end and keep on staring in the blackness with a blue halo.

And they are sharing their frustration on social media.

Me trying not to click on fortnite's exit button after 4 hours watching it's asshole#Fortnitepic.twitter.com/KdKmn9GYLe — Markkus99 (@steveLp_markkus) October 13, 2019

Everyone When They Realise They Have Been Watching A Black Hole On Their Screen For The Last 6 Hours. #Fortnitepic.twitter.com/RLRSgH0VVv — KayRandz Leaks & News - Fortnite (@KayRandz) October 13, 2019

Epic Games, launched in 2017, usually allows up to 100 players to fight until the last is standing on a virtual battlefield.

But on Sunday evening there were no clashes but some numbers occasionally appearing on the screen, and people are trying to make out what they mean.

LOL I just FaceTimed my brother and he hasn’t stopped watching the black hole for 4 hours and he’s using a white board to keep track of these random numbers 😂😂😂 #fortniteevent#fortnite#twitch#TheEndpic.twitter.com/VCH72yidg1 — Grace🔜TwitchCon (@pashproducer) October 13, 2019

The numbers #Fortnite



11 - I

146 - was

15 - not

62 - alone



87 - Others

14 - are

106 - outside

2 - the

150 - loop



69 - This

146 - was

15 - not

36 - calculated



2 - The

176 - nothing

8 - is

160 - now

65 - inevitable — Dansen_1337 (@Dansen_1337) October 13, 2019

Fortnite gamers get large cash prizes in some tournaments, so star players were getting obviously frustrated.

Theories about what happened to the game ranged from hacking to blaming Elon Musk, with the latter tweeting 'Haha.'

Fortnite added to the confusion by deleting tweets on their official account but for the one showing the black hole. There is also a mundane theory of what happened: Fortnite was rumored to mull changing the map, so why not do it with a big bang?

Like this story? Share it with a friend!
description: A black screen with a black dot is what Fortnite has been streaming on its social media channels as its long-anticipated 'The End' event.  Millions have been staring at the black screen mesmerized for hours.
